1.description: A fierce blue SeaWing princess who has just returned to her mother's kingdom after years of captivity. Struggles to adapt to royal life while maintaining her bonds with her fellow dragonets.
1.role: SeaWing Princess and Dragonet of Destiny

15.description: Learns to use Aquatic, the underwater light language of SeaWings, allowing her to communicate properly with her mother and other SeaWings for the first time.

1.description: The kind-hearted brown MudWing continues his journey with the dragonets of destiny. His fireproof scales proved crucial in their escape from Queen Scarlet.

relationships.Peril: Dangerous friend from the SkyWing arena

1.description: The sarcastic RainWing with deadly venom continues her journey with the dragonets. Her quick thinking and lethal abilities helped them escape Queen Scarlet's palace.

relationships.Jambu: RainWing who might be her brother

1.description: The anxious black NightWing scholar continues to provide knowledge and worry in equal measure. Still struggles with his lack of traditional NightWing powers.

relationships.Tsunami: Fellow dragonet he cares for deeply

1.description: The small, optimistic yellow SandWing continues to be the heart of the group. Her unusual appearance and missing tail barb remain mysterious.

2.description: The ruling SeaWing queen and Tsunami's mother. Devastated by the loss of her daughter years ago and overjoyed but overprotective upon her return.

8.description: Reveals she's been writing scrolls about her daughters and the royal family. Extremely protective of her remaining children after losing so many eggs to a mysterious killer.

3.description: Tsunami's younger sister and the heir to the SeaWing throne. A bright green SeaWing princess who has lived her entire life in the Deep Palace.

relationships.Tsunami: Older sister she's eager to know

16.description: Revealed to be an animus dragon with powerful magic abilities. This makes her incredibly valuable and dangerous, explaining Queen Coral's extreme protectiveness.

relationships.Whirlpool: Tutor who wants to control her power
relationships.Tsunami: Sister who wants to protect her from magic's corruption

3.description: The youngest SeaWing princess, still a baby. Queen Coral's latest daughter and the apple of her eye, kept under constant guard.

4.description: The SeaWing king and Queen Coral's husband. A steady presence in the royal family, though often overshadowed by his queen's strong personality.

relationships.Tsunami: Daughter he's glad to have home

1.description: A young blue SeaWing who was part of the Talons of Peace. Now serves as a guard in Queen Coral's palace and shows interest in Princess Tsunami.
1.role: Palace Guard and Former Talons Member

12.description: Reveals more about his past with the Talons of Peace and his genuine feelings for Tsunami, despite their class differences as princess and guard.

5.description: A pompous green SeaWing who serves as royal tutor to the princesses. Overly flattering to Queen Coral and shows inappropriate interest in young Princess Anemone.

relationships.Anemone: Student he shows too much interest in

16.description: His true motives are revealed as he attempts to control Anemone's animus magic for his own gain, showing his manipulative and dangerous nature.

relationships.Anemone: Animus dragon he wants to control

4.description: A large grey SeaWing who serves as one of Queen Coral's palace guards. Strong and loyal but not particularly bright.

6.description: An elderly SeaWing who serves on Queen Coral's royal council. Wise but sometimes questions the queen's decisions regarding the war.

7.description: A light blue SeaWing noble who frequents Queen Coral's court. Gossipy and interested in royal family drama.

9.description: A young SeaWing dragonet who lives in the Deep Palace. Curious about the returned princess and the dragonets of destiny.

8.description: The most intelligent and manipulative of the three SandWing sisters fighting for the throne. Currently allied with Queen Coral and the SeaWings.

22.description: Reveals her true ruthless nature and willingness to eliminate anyone who threatens her path to the throne, including the dragonets if necessary.

relationships.Anemone: Animus dragon she wants to control

1.description: The former guardian of the dragonets, now revealed as Tsunami's egg-thief. Struggles with guilt over his past actions while trying to help the dragonets.
A SeaWing leader of the Talons of Peace organization. Coordinates peace efforts and helps guide the dragonets' mission.

relationships.Tsunami: Princess he hopes will bring peace

11.description: One of Queen Coral's sons and Tsunami's brother. A quiet, bookish SeaWing prince who prefers to stay out of the spotlight.

13.description: A deceased SeaWing princess, Queen Coral's daughter who died years ago. Her death was part of the pattern of mysterious royal egg and dragonet killings.

20.description: Revealed to have been an animus dragon who created a statue that kills royal SeaWing heirs, explaining the mysterious deaths in the royal family.

relationships.Auklet: Sister nearly killed by her creation

7.description: A SeaWing servant who works in Queen Coral's Deep Palace. Helps maintain the royal chambers and serves the royal family.

8.description: A military SeaWing general who serves Queen Coral in the war against the SandWings. Strategic and loyal to the crown.

9.description: A SeaWing soldier serving in Queen Coral's military forces. Participates in patrols and palace security duties.

11.description: A SeaWing who frequents Queen Coral's court. Often seen discussing politics and royal family matters with other nobles.

4.description: A SeaWing guard who protects the Deep Palace and royal family. Works alongside Shark and other guards in palace security.

6.description: A fast SeaWing who serves as a royal messenger, carrying communications between Queen Coral and her allies.

7.description: A SeaWing servant working in the Deep Palace, responsible for maintaining the royal quarters and assisting with daily needs.

18.description: The imposing NightWing who created the dragonet prophecy appears to check on their progress and judge their worthiness for their destiny.

13.description: The largest and most military-minded of the three SandWing sisters. Enemy of Queen Coral and her allies, known for her collection of rare creatures.
The most beautiful but least intelligent of the three SandWing sisters competing for the throne. Currently hiding with the IceWings.

1.description: The dangerous SkyWing with firescales who became Clay's friend. Still searching for her place in the world after leaving Queen Scarlet.

recaps.1: Tsunami and the other dragonets of destiny arrive at the Kingdom of the Sea, where Tsunami hopes to reunite with her SeaWing family and find allies for their mission to end the war.
recaps.2: Tsunami meets her mother Queen Coral for the first time, experiencing the overwhelming joy and complicated emotions of their reunion after years of separation and believing each other dead.
recaps.3: Tsunami is introduced to her younger sisters Princess Anemone and baby Princess Auklet. She struggles to adapt to royal life and the expectations of being a SeaWing princess.
recaps.4: The dragonets explore the magnificent Deep Palace underwater kingdom while Tsunami learns about SeaWing culture, including their unique light-language called Aquatic that she cannot yet understand.
recaps.5: Tsunami meets Whirlpool, the pompous royal tutor who makes her uncomfortable with his overly flattering manner toward Queen Coral and inappropriate interest in young Princess Anemone.
recaps.6: Queen Coral reveals the tragic history of her family - many of her eggs and young dragonets have been mysteriously murdered over the years, explaining her extreme protectiveness of her remaining children.
recaps.7: Tsunami begins learning Aquatic and starts to understand the complex politics of the SeaWing court, while her fellow dragonets explore the underwater kingdom and meet its inhabitants.
recaps.8: Queen Coral shows Tsunami her private study where she writes scrolls about her daughters. Tsunami learns about her mother's alliance with Blister in the SandWing war of succession.
recaps.9: The dragonets attend a royal feast where they meet more SeaWing nobles and courtiers. Tsunami continues to feel torn between her loyalty to her fellow dragonets and her newfound royal responsibilities.
recaps.10: Tensions rise in the palace as Tsunami struggles with the restrictions of royal life. She wants to continue the quest with her fellow dragonets but feels pressure to stay and fulfill her princess duties.
recaps.11: Tsunami meets more of her extended family including her brother Prince Turtle. She learns more about the mysterious deaths that have plagued the royal family for years.
recaps.12: Riptide reveals more about his feelings for Tsunami and his past with the Talons of Peace. Their growing romance is complicated by the difference in their social status.
recaps.13: The mystery of the royal family murders deepens as another attempt is made on a young prince's life. Tsunami begins to suspect someone in the palace is behind the killings.
recaps.14: Tsunami and her friends investigate the palace, looking for clues about who might be killing the royal family members. The danger feels closer than ever.
recaps.15: Tsunami finally masters enough Aquatic to communicate properly with her mother and sister. This breakthrough helps her feel more connected to her SeaWing heritage while maintaining her bonds with the dragonets.
recaps.16: The shocking revelation that Princess Anemone is an animus dragon explains why she's so carefully guarded and why Whirlpool shows such interest in her magical abilities.
recaps.17: With Anemone's animus powers revealed, the danger to the royal family becomes clearer. Tsunami realizes the murders may be connected to preventing animus dragons from being born or surviving.
recaps.18: Morrowseer arrives to check on the dragonets' progress, creating tension as Tsunami must balance her royal duties with her destiny as a dragonet of prophecy.
recaps.19: Political tensions escalate as Blister's influence in the SeaWing kingdom becomes more apparent. Tsunami realizes her mother's ally may not be the right choice for queen.
recaps.20: The truth about Princess Orca is revealed - the dead princess was an animus who created a statue that kills royal heirs, solving the mystery of the family murders.
recaps.21: With the killer statue destroyed, the royal family is finally safe. Tsunami must decide whether to stay in her underwater kingdom or continue with the dragonets on their quest.
recaps.22: Blister reveals her true nature, showing the dragonets how ruthless and manipulative she really is. Tsunami realizes they cannot support her claim to the SandWing throne.
recaps.23: Tensions reach a breaking point as Blister's schemes are exposed. The dragonets realize they must escape the Deep Palace before they become Blister's pawns or victims.
recaps.24: A dramatic confrontation occurs as the dragonets attempt to leave the SeaWing kingdom. Tsunami must choose between her royal duties and her destiny with her fellow dragonets.
recaps.25: The dragonets prepare to leave the Kingdom of the Sea, with Tsunami having learned valuable lessons about leadership, family, and the complexity of choosing the right side in war.
recaps.26: Tsunami says goodbye to her family, including her mother Queen Coral and sister Anemone. Despite their tearful parting, she knows she must continue with the prophecy mission.
recaps.27: The dragonets leave the SeaWing kingdom with new allies and a clearer understanding of the political complexities they face. Tsunami has grown into her role as both princess and prophesied dragonet.
